name: From Accrue to Zoo Quiz | Alphabetical Words | 25 Questions

questions.text: I want to begin my life _______.

questions.explanation:
coup.

	Or clue, coo, cue, or crew.

ecru.

	You can use strong black tea to dye white cloth ecru.

froufrou & frou-frou.

	This word also means 'a rustling sound.'

hullabaloo.

	Or Hugh, hew, or hue.

jujitsu & jujutsu & jiujitsu & jiujutsu.

	Or jackaroo (which means 'an inexperienced ranch hand').

questions.text: A instrument that just about anyone can play?
questions.explanation:
kazoo.

	Or kangaroo or knew or Katroo (home of Dr. Seuss's Birthday Bird).

questions.text: A French word meaning 'place'? (Now part of the English language--we mispronounce it, though.)
questions.explanation:
lieu.

	Or Lou went to the loo.

questions.text: The boy _______ his shoes in six months.
questions.explanation:
outgrew.

	Or outdo, overdo, overshoe or ormolu (fake gold).

Sioux.

	Or Sue or slew, slough, sue, or shoe.

through.

	I'm almost through. Or threw or true.

questions.text: Newspaper reporters need to answer these questions: When? Where? What? How? Why? and _______?
questions.explanation:
Who.

	Owls and trains make this sound.

questions.text: I'm skipping X. The English translation for the French word 'vous'?

questions.explanation:
Zulu.

	The Zulu people, along with many other black African groups, make up the majority of South Africa's population.
